course_title: Fresh Sem: Sociology: Data Science for Beginners
class_notes:
(Same as LING 190 1, QTM 190 2) (Freshmen Seminar - Limited to First Year Students Only)


The course deals with new tools for the automatic analysis and visualization of words. Sounds scary? Just wait until you see what these computational tools can do! That's scary! But the rest is surprisingly easy. You start with a bag of words, and at the press of a button you can automatically display on a map any location mentioned in that bag. That same bag of words can be displayed automatically in a word-cloud where more frequent words appear in bigger fonts, in beautiful colors. You could even display these words on a picture of your pretty face. That same bag of words is full of sentences. And unless you dropped the bag and scrambled all the words' a computer can figure out which words are nouns, verbs, or adjectives; which are locations or dates. It can tell whether a sentence is active or passive, well written or not. It can visualize information about subjects, verbs, and objects in beautiful graphs. Indeed, there is a lot a computer can do with words. The course has no prerequisites. But if you are not at ease with computers you will find the course challenging and you will struggle. There will be weekly readings that allow you to understand the tools, and homework and presentations throughout the semester.
course_description: A small class on topics of sociological concern that fosters a highly interactive and mutually collaborative learning environment among students and between students and teachers.
schedule_location: MW 2:30pm-3:45pm in Emerson Chemistry Bldg. E103
